places.name: By Hand Pizza Caf√©
places.review: Wood-fired artisan pizza with naturally fermented dough. Suu says it's like kimchi - the fermentation makes everything better! The Summer Pizza with fresh ricotta is absolutely divine. ü•¢‚û°Ô∏èüçï
places.address: 25 Moon Muang Road Soi 7, Si Phum, Chiang Mai
places.suuQuote: The fermented dough reminds me of home - just like kimchi, time makes everything more delicious!

places.name: Freely Pizza
places.review: Hidden gem with incredible thin-crust pizza and a cozy atmosphere. The owners are so passionate about their craft, reminds me of Korean dedication to perfection!
places.suuQuote: Small place, big flavors - just how I like my pizza adventures!

places.name: Chiang Mai Slice
places.review: Cozy spot with thin crust perfection and the friendliest staff. Their spicy tom yum pizza is a fusion masterpiece!
places.suuQuote: They put tom yum on pizza and it WORKS! Fusion done right.

places.name: Seoul Pizza Lab
places.review: Creative toppings and great atmosphere. Being back home in Seoul, this place serves Korean-style corn and sweet potato pizza that actually works!
places.suuQuote: Finally, pizza that understands Korean taste buds! The corn pizza here is legendary.

places.name: Napoli Classic
places.review: Authentic Neapolitan pies straight from the oven. This is where pizza was born, and you can taste centuries of tradition in every bite!
places.suuQuote: The birthplace of pizza - like visiting the kimchi capital of Korea!

places.name: Tokyo Tomato
places.review: Fusion-style slices with a local twist. Japanese attention to detail meets Italian passion - the teriyaki chicken pizza is surprisingly amazing!
places.suuQuote: Only the Japanese could make teriyaki pizza work this well!

places.name: Berlin Dough
places.review: Late-night favorite with crispy bases and generous toppings. Perfect after exploring Berlin's amazing food scene!
places.suuQuote: Great for late-night munchies, though nothing beats Korean fried chicken at 3am!

places.name: NYC Pie Co.
places.review: Classic New York slices done right. Huge, foldable slices that remind me why NYC pizza is legendary!
places.suuQuote: You haven't lived until you've folded a NYC slice like a pro!

places.name: Melbourne Mozzarella
places.review: Laid-back spot with rich flavors and amazing coffee. The Aussie hospitality makes every bite better!
places.suuQuote: Great pizza and even better coffee - the Australian way!

places.name: Rio Pizza House
places.review: Beachside pizza with tropical vibes. Eating pizza while watching the sunset over Copacabana - pure magic!
places.suuQuote: Pizza by the beach hits different - like Korean chicken and beer by the Han River!

places.name: Parisian Pie
places.review: Charming bistro serving gourmet slices with French flair. They put truffle on everything and somehow it works!
places.suuQuote: Leave it to the French to make pizza fancy - and delicious!

places.name: Toronto Toppings
places.review: Modern take on traditional pizza with Canadian hospitality. The maple bacon pizza is surprisingly not too sweet!
places.suuQuote: They put maple syrup on pizza and apologized for how good it was - so Canadian!
